title: Property Tax Exemption for Disabled Veterans and Survivors
summary: Property tax exemption on the assessed value of a primary residence for eligible disabled veterans and certain survivors; amount varies by town (minimum threshold set by state; towns may increase).

requirements.notes: Municipal amount varies; application is submitted to VT Office of Veterans Affairs by annual deadline (commonly May 1).

eligibilityNotes: Submit the state application with required documentation by the deadline listed on the form. Exemption amount is determined by your town (minimum set by state; some towns vote to increase).

title: Veteran Free License Privilege (Hunting/Fishing)
summary: Application for certain free or discounted hunting/fishing license privileges for eligible veterans (administered via Vermont Fish & Wildlife).

requirements.notes: Eligibility requirements and documentation are specified on the application.

eligibilityNotes: Complete the application and include required documentation per the form; submit to Vermont Fish & Wildlife at the address listed on the application.

title: Vermont National Guard Tuition Benefit Program (VNGTBP)
summary: Tuition coverage for active Vermont National Guard members in good standing (administered via VSAC; amount varies by institution/program).

requirements.notes: Must be an active VTNG member in good standing; see VSAC program eligibility and covered institutions/programs.

eligibilityNotes: Apply through VSAC and coordinate with your school’s financial aid/veteran services office. Program details and amounts vary by institution and program.

title: VNG Tuition Benefit Program Statute (16 V.S.A. § 2857)
summary: Vermont statutory authority describing the Vermont National Guard Tuition Benefit Program and administration/payment mechanics.
eligibilityNotes: Use this citation when you need the legal basis/definitions for the program and its requirements.
